greeting: Greetings from The On-Line Encyclopedia of Integer Sequences! http://oeis.org/

results.name: Decimal expansion of fine-structure constant alpha.
reference: John Barrow, The Constants of Nature, 367pp, Jonathan Cape, 2002.
H. J. Fischbeck and K. Fischbeck, Formulas. Facts and Constants, Springer-Verlag, NY, 2nd ed., 1987.
K. R. Lang, Astrophysical Data: Planets and Stars, Springer-Verlag, NY, 1991.
Martin J. Rees. Just Six Numbers: the deep forces that shape the universe. Phoenix. 1999
N. J. A. Sloane and Simon Plouffe, The Encyclopedia of Integer Sequences, Academic Press, 1995 (includes this sequence).
formula: alpha = e^2/(4*Pi*E*h*c), where e is the elementary charge (A081823), E is the electric constant (A081799), h is the reduced Planck constant (A254181), c is the speed of light (A003678). - _Ilya Gutkovskiy_, Jul 27 2016
alpha = V_n1/c = A081800/A003678. - _Omar E. Pol_, Mar 11 2018
results.author: _N. J. A. Sloane_, _Mira Bernstein_
ext: Updated by _Omar E. Pol_, Aug 09 2009, _R. J. Mathar_, Dec 15 2012
Definition edited by _N. J. A. Sloane_, Feb 11 2016
